It seems there might be a bit of confusion as the films you've listed don't all align with the user's preference cues for German movies in German language. However, let me suggest two captivating German films that you may enjoy:

1. 'Good Bye Lenin!' (2003) - A heartwarming comedy-drama about a son who goes to great lengths to protect his mother from the reality of post-communist Germany after she wakes up from a coma. Starring Daniel Brühl and Maria Simon.

2. 'The Lives of Others' (2006) - A gripping political thriller set in East Berlin during the Cold War, about an agent ordered to bug a playwright but finds himself becoming emotionally entangled with his subjects. Featuring Ulrich Mühe and Martina Gedeck.

Both films are critically acclaimed and offer fascinating insights into German history. Enjoy your movie time!
